Peak Alcohol consumption is a **input factor**. It means that it is one of the inputs from the user to the model.

#### Alternative names:
* Peak alcohol
* Peak Alcohol consumption
* MaxDrinking

#### Uses

Peak Alcohol consumption is used by the model in the following places

* [Coronary heart disease](/model/Ischemic)

#### Guidance

The user input is a typed number and should answer the question

> In a normal month what is the highest amount of alcohol drunk during a single day?

The unit of the input is **Drinks**.

The answer has to be larger than 0 Drinks. The answer is recommended to be larger than 0 Drinks and smaller than 30 Drinks. A drink is defined as a US standard drink containing 14 grams of pure alcohol.


### Optimizability

[Optimizability](/model/optimizabilities) is a subjective measure that we have made to describe how easy it is to optimize a certain factor of your life. The optimizability of Peak Alcohol consumption is 5. This means that it can be interpreted as

> *It is possible to change, and it can be changed now or very soon.*
